intro: Phlegmariurus hemleri, commonly known as the yellow spruce moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It is characterized by its bright yellow-green color and is typically found growing on decaying wood in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a delicate, cushion-like growth form and produces spores in capsules that are often clustered at the tips of its stems. It is widely distributed in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of North America and Europe. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to both botanists and nature enthusiasts.
